revised_title: Balancing and Encouraging Scientific Development in British Universities
tldr: In 1945, a conference of Fellows at the Royal Society discussed the needs of research in fundamental science and the development of scientific subjects in British universities. The Sectional Committees were tasked with exploring this problem further and considering the distribution of subjects in universities. The committees recommended encouraging special subjects in certain places and keeping the distribution of subjects under review to ensure balanced development of scientific research.
